description: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.source.repoURL

description: TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.source.targetRevision

description: Sources overrides the source definition set in the application. This is typically set in a Rollback operation and is nil during a Sync operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources

description: Chart is a Helm chart name, and must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.chart

description: Directory holds path/directory specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.directory

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.helm.passCredentials

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.forceCommonAnnotations

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.forceCommonLabels

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.images

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.labelWithoutSelector

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.namePrefix

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.nameSuffix

description: Namespace sets the namespace that Kustomize adds to all resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.namespace

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.kustomize.patches

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.sources.*.targetRevision

description: SyncOptions provide per-sync sync-options, e.g. Validate=false
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncOptions

description: SyncStrategy describes how to perform the sync
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncStrategy

description: Apply will perform a kubectl apply to perform the sync.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncStrategy.apply

description: Force indicates whether or not to supply the --force flag to kubectl apply. The --force flag deletes and re-create the resource, when PATCH encounters conflict and has retried for 5 times.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncStrategy.apply.force

description: Hook will submit any referenced resources to perform the sync. This is the default strategy
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncStrategy.hook

description: Force indicates whether or not to supply the --force flag to kubectl apply. The --force flag deletes and re-create the resource, when PATCH encounters conflict and has retried for 5 times.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.operation.sync.syncStrategy.hook.force

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.phase

description: RetryCount contains time of operation retries
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.retryCount

description: StartedAt contains time of operation start
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.startedAt

description: SyncResult is the result of a Sync operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult

description: ManagedNamespaceMetadata contains the current sync state of managed namespace metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.managedNamespaceMetadata

description: Resources contains a list of sync result items for each individual resource in a sync operation

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources

description: Group specifies the API group of the resource
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.group

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.hookPhase

description: HookType specifies the type of the hook. Empty for non-hook resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.hookType

description: Kind specifies the API kind of the resource
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.kind

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.name

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.namespace

description: SyncPhase indicates the particular phase of the sync that this result was acquired in

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.resources.<name>.version

description: Revision holds the revision this sync operation was performed to
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.revision

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.revisions

description: IgnoreMissingValueFiles prevents helm template from failing when valueFiles do not exist locally by not appending them to helm template --values
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.ignoreMissingValueFiles

description: Parameters is a list of Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.parameters

description: ForceString determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.parameters.<name>.name

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.passCredentials

description: ReleaseName is the Helm release name to use. If omitted it will use the application name
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.releaseName

description: SkipCrds skips custom resource definition installation step (Helm's --skip-crds)
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.skipCrds

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.valueFiles

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.values

description: ValuesObject specifies Helm values to be passed to helm template, defined as a map. This takes precedence over Values.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.valuesObject

description: Version is the Helm version to use for templating ("3")
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.helm.version

description: Kustomize holds kustomize specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize

description: CommonAnnotations is a list of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.commonAnnotations

description: CommonAnnotationsEnvsubst specifies whether to apply env variables substitution for annotation values
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.commonAnnotationsEnvsubst

description: CommonLabels is a list of additional labels to add to rendered manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.commonLabels

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.components

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.forceCommonAnnotations

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.forceCommonLabels

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.images

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.labelWithoutSelector

description: NamePrefix is a prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.namePrefix

description: NameSuffix is a suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.nameSuffix

description: Namespace sets the namespace that Kustomize adds to all resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.namespace

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.patches

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.replicas.<name>.count

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.replicas.<name>.name

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.kustomize.version

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.env.<name>.name

description: Value is the value of the variable
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.env.<name>.value

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.parameters

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.array

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.map

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.name

description: String_ is the value of a string type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.string

description: Ref is reference to another source within sources field. This field will not be used if used with a source tag.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.ref

description: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.repoURL

description: TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.operationState.syncResult.sources.*.targetRevision

description: ReconciledAt indicates when the application state was reconciled using the latest git version
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.reconciledAt

description: ResourceHealthSource indicates where the resource health status is stored: inline if not set or appTree
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resourceHealthSource

description: Resources is a list of Kubernetes resources managed by this application
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resources

description: HealthStatus contains information about the currently observed health state of an application or resource
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resources.<name>.health

description: Message is a human-readable informational message describing the health status
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resources.<name>.health.message

description: Status holds the status code of the application or resource
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resources.<name>.health.status

description: SyncStatusCode is a type which represents possible comparison results
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.resources.<name>.status

description: SourceType specifies the type of this application
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sourceType

description: SourceTypes specifies the type of the sources included in the application
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sourceTypes

description: Summary contains a list of URLs and container images used by this application
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.summary

description: ExternalURLs holds all external URLs of application child resources.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.summary.externalURLs

description: Images holds all images of application child resources.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.summary.images

description: Sync contains information about the application's current sync status
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync

description: ComparedTo contains information about what has been compared
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo

description: Destination is a reference to the application's destination used for comparison
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.destination

description: Name is an alternate way of specifying the target cluster by its symbolic name. This must be set if Server is not set.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.destination.name

description: Namespace specifies the target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.destination.namespace

description: Server specifies the URL of the target cluster's Kubernetes control plane API. This must be set if Name is not set.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.destination.server

description: IgnoreDifferences is a reference to the application's ignored differences used for comparison

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.ignoreDifferences

name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.ignoreDifferences.<name>.managedFieldsManagers

description: Version controls which version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.kustomize.version

description: Path is a directory path within the Git repository, and is only valid for applications sourced from Git.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.path

description: Plugin holds config management plugin specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin

description: Env is a list of environment variable entries
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.env

description: Name is the name of the variable, usually expressed in uppercase
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.env.<name>.name

description: Value is the value of the variable
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.env.<name>.value

type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.parameters

description: Array is the value of an array type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.array

description: String_ is the value of a string type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.plugin.parameters.<name>.string

description: Ref is reference to another source within sources field. This field will not be used if used with a source tag.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.ref

description: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.repoURL

description: TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.comparedTo.sources.*.targetRevision

description: Revision contains information about the revision the comparison has been performed to
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.revision

description: Revisions contains information about the revisions of multiple sources the comparison has been performed to
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.revisions

description: Status is the sync state of the comparison
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.status.sync.status

description: ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision

description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.apiVersion

description: Data is the serialized representation of the state.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.data

description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.kind

description: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata

description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/annotations
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.annotations

description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.creationTimestamp

description: Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set. May only be shortened. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.deletionGracePeriodSeconds

description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked. Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time. For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds, the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup, remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the resource is fully terminated. If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.deletionTimestamp

description: Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.finalizers

description:
GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server.

If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will return a 409.

Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.generateName

description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state. Populated by the system. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.generation

description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.labels

description: ManagedFields maps workflow-id and version to the set of fields that are managed by that workflow. This is mostly for internal housekeeping, and users typically shouldn't need to set or understand this field. A workflow can be the user's name, a controller's name, or the name of a specific apply path like "ci-cd". The set of fields is always in the version that the workflow used when modifying the object.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.managedFields

description: APIVersion defines the version of this resource that this field set applies to. The format is "group/version" just like the top-level APIVersion field. It is necessary to track the version of a field set because it cannot be automatically converted.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.apiVersion

description: FieldsType is the discriminator for the different fields format and version. There is currently only one possible value: "FieldsV1"
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.fieldsType

description: FieldsV1 holds the first JSON version format as described in the "FieldsV1" type.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.fieldsV1

description: Manager is an identifier of the workflow managing these fields.
name: applications.<name>.resources.apps.v1.ControllerRevision.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.manager
